page.title: 06RATHS
page.content: These were in fact farmsteads used by the{Celts }generally called forts.They were mainly circular in design and the land containing the house was surrounded by an earthen bank or stone wall and a ditch.those surrounded by earth banks were commonly called{ {raths.} Forts varied greatly in size but were usually 4O-5O metres in diameter.There was only one entrance which was closed at night.Animals would have been brought inside at night to keep them safe from wild animals and thieves. To-day these forts are overgrown with whins, blackthorns, sally, ash and bramble. some country people still refer to them as fairy forts and regard them as magic places where humans are not really safe .
